questions.text: Which of the following will be expected to occur with increased binding of a hormone to plasma proteins?

options.label: A
options.text: Increase in plasma clearance of the hormone

options.label: B
options.text: Increase in half-life of the hormone

options.label: D
options.text: Increase in degree of negative feedback exerted by the hormone

questions.correct_answer: B. Increase in half-life of the hormone

questions.text: A 75-year-old man who smoked 20-30 cigarettes per day for the last 55 years reports with shortness of breath. The patient is diagnosed with chronic pulmonary emphysema. Which of the following will be seen in this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: Increase in elastic recoil of the lungs

questions.text: A patient with severe hypertension (Bp 180/110 mm Hg) is referred to you. A renal MRI scan shows a tumor in the kidney, and lab findings include a very high plasma renin activity. The diagnosis is a renin- secreting tumor. Which of the following changes would you expect to find in this patient, under steady state conditions, compared with normal?
Which of the following transport mechanisms is not rate limited by an intrinsic T max ?

options.label: D
options.text: Movement of ions through ion channels

questions.correct_answer: D. Movement of ions through ion channels

questions.text: Which of the following conditions is likely to decrease the mean systemic filling pressure?

During his 1 physical examination following birth at home with the assistance of a midwife, a 5-week-old male is suspected to have congenital hypothyroidism. His parents refused all newborn screening at the time of his birth. Which of the following may be the earliest clinical sign of congenital hypothyroidism?

A 1-day-old is identified to be cyanotic, with an oxygen saturation measured at 71%. Minimal improvement is noted after initiation of supplemental oxygen. Which of the following is the most common cyanotic heart defect manifesting in the first days of life?
questions.correct_answer: E. Transposition of the great arteries

questions.text: An 11-month-old female presents with a 3-day history of increased temperature, irritability, decreased appetite, and malaise. Although she was afebrile on the morning of presentation, her parents are now concerned about a rash that they report has been present for only the last several hours. On physical examination, she is afebrile and appears generally well. A blanching macular and maculopapular rash is present on the upper torso, face, and neck. A smaller number of similar lesions are noted on the upper thighs. Despite her relatively reassuring clinical appearance, a lumbar puncture is performed due to the presence of a bulging anterior fontanelle. The fluid is clear with zero WBCs, and no organisms are seen on Gram stain. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient’s clinical signs and symptoms?

A 4-year-old boy is admitted to the intensive care unit with altered mental status, fever, and rash. Cerebrospinal fluid cultures are positive for Streptococcus pneumoniae. Although initially very ill, he survives and is steadily improving. During a meeting to discuss discharge planning and follow up, his parents inquire about potential long-term sequelae of his infection. Which of the following represents the most common complication in children who survive an episode of bacterial meningitis?

A 16-month-old boy presents with a 48-hour history of subjective fever, cough, decreased activity, and decreased appetite. Findings on physical examination are limited to numerous small, irregular, erythematous spots with a minute, bluish-white center located on the buccal mucosa. Which of the following clinical findings is most likely to be identified in this patient within the next several days?

options.label: A
options.text: Bilateral nonexudative conjunctivitis associated with fissured, dry, cracked, and erythematous lips and cervical adenopathy

options.label: B
options.text: Multiple, small, maculopapular erythematous lesions involving mainly the hands and feet

options.label: C
options.text: A petechial rash on the extremities with prominence over the wrists and ankles and associated with edema of the hands and feet

options.label: D
options.text: Multiple, grouped, vesicular lesions (some of which have ulcerated) covering the tongue and buccal mucosa and associated with gingival edema and erythema

options.label: E
options.text: A confluent erythematous rash that is most prominent over the trunk and associated with coryza and conjunctivitis

questions.correct_answer: E. A confluent erythematous rash that is most prominent over the trunk and associated with coryza and conjunctivitis

questions.text: A critically ill child is found to have a normal anion gap metabolic acidosis. Which of the following is characteristically associated with this finding?

A 5-year-old boy presents to the emergency department after his parents noted that his “urine looked bloody.” Soon after arrival, he has an episode of gross hematuria. Urinalysis reveals red blood cells too numerous to count and moderate proteinuria. His blood pressure is 100/70 mmHg. He is referred for additional subspecialty evaluation that includes an ophthalmologic examination. That exam is positive for extrusion of the central portion of the lens into the anterior chamber, macular flecks, and corneal erosions. Which of the following is the most likely etiology of this patient’s clinical and urinary findings?

During a scheduled health supervision visit, the mother of a 10-year-old boy questions when she can expect her son to begin puberty. Which of the following is the first physical sign to occur during pubertal development in males?

options.label: D
options.text: Increase in the length of the penis

questions.text: A 3-year-old girl with a history of developmental delay presents with her foster parents for an evaluation following removal from her home by a social services agency due to medical neglect. Her height, weight, and head circumference are all below the 3 percentile. Facial features include short palpebral fissures; mild ptosis; a shortened nose associated with midface hypoplasia; a long, thin philtrum; and a thin upper lip. Which of the following is most likely to be identified during additional evaluation?

A 34 weeks of gestation male is found to have malformations, atrophy, and scarring of both lower extremities, and cataracts associated with microphthalmia and microcephaly. Review of maternal prenatal laboratory results, obtained when the patient’s mother was in her 6th week of pregnancy, is most likely to reveal which of the following?

A 50-year-old female presents with chronic upper GI complaints. Upper GI endoscopy shows proliferating mass in the stomach and she was eventually diagnosed to have gastric carcinoma. During sugery, before approaching the stomach, lesser omentum is seen. Free edge of lesser omentum formed by:
Action of the marked muscle?
The following diagram depicts the various parts from which the diaphragm develops . Defects in which part most commonly leads to congenital diaphragmatic hernia:
A patient complains of localized pain in a swollen lower calf and cannot strongly plantar flex his foot. What tendon may have ruptured?

A 75-year-old patient presents to the dermatologist with a 4 cm brown lesion on the right cheek (Figure A). The patient states that the lesion has been there for years but just recently began to change in appearance. She has noticed cracking and oozing from the lesion over the past few months. The lesion most likely originated from a cell derived from which germ cell line

A 37 years old P3L3 patient has come with a history of post coital bleeding since last 3 months. On examination, it was found that she has a large cervical growth of 5 cm. It was spreading till the parametrial tissue but not involving the ureters or the lateral pelvic wall. On biopsy, there was a large cell non keratinising squamous cell carcinoma. Which of the following is the best treatment for her?

A 62 years old post-menopausal patient was found to have an ovarian tumour of 5 cm in the right ovary. Her CA-125 is 1230 IU/L. Staging laparotomy was done and it was found that it was in one ovary. Peritoneal washing was negative, capsule was intact and surface of the tumour was smooth and cancer-free. Total hysterectomy with bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy was done and the histopathology report revealed serous cystadenocarcinoma of well differentiated type. What additional step is required in the treatment of this patient?
questions.correct_answer: D. No further treatment is necessary.

questions.text: As per the latest SAGE guideline by WHO, what is the number of doses of HPV vaccine required?

options.label: A
options.text: 1-2 doses for the age group of 9-20 years, 1 dose for the age group of >20-45 years.

options.label: B
options.text: 2 doses for the age group of 9-20 years, 3 doses for the age group of >20-45 years.

options.label: C
options.text: 1-2 doses for the age group of 9-20 years, 2 doses for the age group of >20-45 years.

options.label: D
options.text: 1 dose for the age group of 9-20 years, 3 doses for the age group of >20-45 years.

questions.correct_answer: A. 1-2 doses for the age group of 9-20 years, 1 dose for the age group of >20-45 years.

questions.text: Endometrial carcinoma which is spread till the surface of the uterus is of which stage?

A 63 years old post-menopausal patient has post-menopausal bleeding. On TVS, there was a polypoidal growth in the fundal region with endometrial thickness 1mm on the remaining walls of uterus. What is the next line of management?

options.label: C
options.text: Hysteroscopy guided fractional curettage and polypectomy

questions.correct_answer: C. Hysteroscopy guided fractional curettage and polypectomy

questions.text: In order to confirm the diagnosis of suspected cancer, which one of the following growths should not be subjected to biopsy?
Which one of the following is not a tubal patency test?

An infertile couple was examined and evaluated for infertility since last 4 years. It was found that there was a fibroid of 4 cm of FIGO-4 type in the uterus, tubes were patent. Semen analysis report was suggestive of azoospermia with very high FSH levels. Which of the following is best line of management?

options.label: A
options.text: Myomectomy in female and donor-insemination for male factor of infertility

options.label: C
options.text: Myomectomy and for male factor infertility – pulsatile GnRH therapy

questions.correct_answer: B. Donor insemination for male infertility

questions.text: Ambiguous genitalia at birth is not a feature of?
Which one of the following is not a possible feature of uterine didelphys?
Which one of the following is used in a case of stress urinary incontinence?
Martius flap surgery is used in which of the following cases?
The most common site of ureteric injury in gynaecological surgery is?

options.label: C
options.text: Crossing of ureter and uterine artery

questions.text: A 28 years old nulliparous patient has developed invasive mole which was of 2 cm size in the myometrium of uterus. She has one lung nodule (metastasis) of 1 cm size. Her HCG levels are 14000 IU/L. She underwent suction and evacuation 2 months back for a complete molar pregnancy. Which of the following is optimal treatment in this case?
A 32 years old nulliparous patient has had a successful IVF pregnancy. Her embryo transfer was done on 21st January 2022. The stage of embryo transfer was day-3. Calculate the EDD in this case.
A 26 years old primipara has developed vulval haematoma after delivery. Which of the following vessel must be injured?
Which of the following is not a part of AMTSL guideline by WHO?
Which of the following is not correct regarding HELLP syndrome?

A 23 years old primigravida has mitral stenosis of moderate type. She is NYHA class 1 patient. She has got labour contractions at 38 weeks. There is no CPD. Which of the following is not correct regarding the management?

options.label: A
options.text: Epidural analgesia can not be given since it can cause hypotension

options.label: B
options.text: Oxytocin can be given for augmentation of labour

options.label: D
options.text: Cut short 2nd stage of labour by forceps.

questions.correct_answer: A. Epidural analgesia can not be given since it can cause hypotension

questions.text: A patient has taken MMR vaccine. For how many months she should avoid pregnancy?
A 27 years old Primigravida has hyperemesis gravidarum. Which of the following is not seen in this case?
Which of the following is incorrect regarding complete molar pregnancy?

options.text: Most common symptom is vaginal bleeding

options.label: D
options.text: Double bleb sign – amniotic sac and yolk sac

questions.correct_answer: C. Piskacek sign – lateral forniceal pulsations

questions.text: A 33 years old nulliparous patient has history of 3 abortions at 8 to 10 weeks. Which of the following is not a possible cause?

A patient comes with red scaly lesions all over the body. Almost the full body surface seems to be involved. He also reports fever on and off. His skin sheds scale all the time. His nails have also started becoming abnormal and he reports scaling on the scalp as well. Lesions increase in winter. What is the likely diagnosis?
Chlamydia causes all except

A patient with itching in the groin comes to you. on examination you find angular scaly lesions. KOH examination is sent which confirms dermatophytes. On culture red colonies are seen. The likely organism is:
Which of the following diseases are associated with metabolic syndrome ?

The following features are useful in identifying Ventricular Tachycardia from SVT with BBB EXCEPT:

options.label: B
options.text: Presence of Capture beats and Fusion beats

questions.text: Which test is performed to detect reversible myocardial ischemia?

A 26-year-old man complains of abdominal distension. swelling of the legs and easy fatigability. His blood pressure is 70mm Hg and pulse becomes difficult to feel on inspiration. JVP is grossly elevated and rises further on deep inspiration. He has pedal edema, ascites and tender hepatomegaly. Precordium is quiet. The probable diagnosis is:
Ideal investigation for adrenal insufficiency is:
The level of which one of the following hormones is likely to increase after hypothalamic ablation?
The syndrome of inappropriate antidiuretic hormone (ADH) is characterized by
All of the following are true about Alzheimer’s disease except –

options.label: A
options.text: Average age of onset is 65 years

options.label: C
options.text: Number of neurofibrillary tangles is associated with the severity of dementia

options.label: D
options.text: Retrograde amnesia can occur early and precedes anterograde amnesia

questions.correct_answer: D. Retrograde amnesia can occur early and precedes anterograde amnesia

questions.text: True Statement about Alzheimer’s disease is

options.label: A
options.text: Associated with involvement of Frontal and Parietal lobe dominantly

options.label: B
options.text: Associated with Capgras syndrome in majority cases during early stages

options.label: C
options.text: Neuroimaging shows Effacement of Sulci & gyri along with dilated ventricles

options.label: D
options.text: Apo E2 is the Protective Allele

questions.correct_answer: D. Apo E2 is the Protective Allele

questions.text: A 60-year-old alcoholic male presented with urinary incontinence and abnormal gait since 3 months. He also complains of loss of memory. What is the diagnosis?

The wife of a 48-year-old male patient brings him to the emergency room and says that his memory has progressively gotten worse over the last several years. She also says his personality has been changing. The physician notes abnormal writhing movements of the man's limbs and hyperreactive reflexes. MRI reveals a loss of volume in the neostriatum and cortex. This disease is inherited as a ----------- trait?

A 27-year-old female junior doctor presents to ER with pleuritic chest pain and shortness of breath. Her ABG shows Pao2 of 55mm of Hg . She uses OCP. Her vital signs are: BP- 86/44 mmHg, P- 130/ min, RR- 30 /min, SpO2 85% on room air. Her ECHO reveals RV hypokinesia. CT chest is shown What is the most appropriate therapy?

A 45 years old male had COVID pneumonia with spo2 85 % & had to be intubated for respiratory failure. His Neutrophil / Lymphocyte ratio is 7, CRP is 80 ug /mL , ferritin 1000ng /ml & D-dimer : 0.4 ug/ml. The ventilator settings are assist control with tidal volume 500 mL and frequency of 15 breaths/min. He weighs 60 kg. His chest x-ray is given below. True regarding management is :

options.label: A
options.text: Avoid sedation and neuromuscular blockade as he is in respiratory failure

options.label: B
options.text: Prone positioning is not indicated as he is ventilated

options.label: D
options.text: Decrease ventilator frequency to 10 breaths per min

questions.correct_answer: C. Decrease tidal volume to 360 mL.

questions.text: Clinical features of massive pulmonary embolism can include all except:

options.label: B
options.text: Tachycardia and elevated jugular venous pulse

questions.text: Features of sarcoidosis can include all except:

options.label: C
options.text: Cough and dyspnoea are the most common presenting symptoms.

options.label: D

questions.correct_answer: D. The most common hematologic problem is lymphocytosis and biopsy show non caseating granulomas

questions.text: The following statements are true regarding bronchial obstruction except

options.label: B
options.text: Breath sounds can be absent on affected part

options.label: C
options.text: Inhaled foreign bodies usually lodge in left main bronchus

options.label: D
options.text: Bronchial obstruction can predispose to bronchiectasis

questions.correct_answer: C. Inhaled foreign bodies usually lodge in left main bronchus

questions.text: Which is the most common life-threatening/dreaded complication seen in CKD patients?
Secondary MPGN is seen in all except

A 75-year-old lady with fracture neck of femur presents with two days history altered sensorium and decreased urinary output. Serum calcium is 15.5 mg/dl, urea is 140 mg/dl, creatinine is 2 mg/dl. All of the following are useful for immediate, management of hypercalcemia, Except;
The most reliable test for detection of Microalbuminuria is

options.label: B
options.text: Spot urinary Albumin to creatinine ration

questions.text: Anti Rho bodies are present in all EXCEPT:
Triad of purpura , weakness and arthralgia are a feature of ?
Most specific antibody to diagnose RA is
All of the following are known to cause drug induced Lupus except:

A 28-year-old man comes to the physician complaining that he is "just not feeling like myself." This feeling began soon after his younger brother passed away from cancer 3 months ago. The patient is no longer interested in work or going out with friends on weekends. He falls asleep relatively easily at night but awakes very early in the morning and is unable to fall back asleep. He admits to feeling "down in the dumps," especially when he first wakes up but says that his mood improves a little during the day. The patient often thinks about ways that he could have spent more time with his brother. He feels guilty about his brother's death being his fault "because I am worthless and could not love him enough." His poor energy and concentration have started to affect his performance at work, and he frequently thinks that he should just quit "because I am bringing everyone down." The patient has been eating less and has lost 3 kgs over the past few weeks. What is this patient's most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is the most important diagnostic information that differentiates bipolar disorder from schizophrenia?

A 27 -year-old woman comes to the physician complaining of abdominal pain for the past 2 years. The pain is constant and unrelated to meals. She also complains of nausea and a bloating sensation. The patient has had no weight or bowel movement changes. She has consulted many physicians about her problem and has undergone multiple endoscopies and colonoscopies and an exploratory laparoscopy to no avail. She has been unable to work as she cannot focus on anything other than her physical discomfort. The patient is very frustrated that physicians have been unable to arrive at a diagnosis and pleads for help. Her father died of colon cancer 5 years ago at 65. Physical examination shows no abnormalities, and an extensive laboratory workup is negative. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

A 41 -year-old woman agrees to talk with her physician at her husband's insistence. She says, "I've always had trouble throwing things away, especially magazines, newspapers, books, old clothes, and lots of miscellaneous household items." She thinks she may need the items again or wonders if discarded items may increase in value. Her husband is concerned that the large piles in their house continue to grow, making it difficult to move around or find a place to sit. The patient's family is embarrassed by her actions and refuses to have relatives or friends over to visit. She has attempted to clean rooms or throw things away on many occasions but always becomes anxious at the thought of parting with various items. She feels guilty and sometimes cries when considering the toll on her family. The patient has no problems with sleep, appetite, concentration, or motivation. In addition to recommending cognitive behavioral therapy, what is the most appropriate initial treatment approach?
Which of the following is NOT a medical cause of panic attacks?
Amino acid regulating sleep wake cycle is Zell
Glucose 6 phosphatase deficiency results in

options.label: C
options.text: Reduced glycogenolysis but gluconeogenesis is normal

options.label: D
options.text: No effect on blood sugar levels in fasting state

questions.text: Not an essential fatty acid ?
Not correct of mitochondrial DNA

options.label: D
options.text: Codes all the proteins of electron transport chain

questions.correct_answer: D. Codes all the proteins of electron transport chain

options.text: Gain of function mutation of PCSK9

options.text: The area marked is aphakic area

questions.text: What is the ocular management of this patient of Diabetes mellitus?

A diabetic patient comes to your office with sudden painless loss of vision in one eye. Vision was Hand movements and there was no view of retina by indirect ophthalmoscopy. What should be the next investigation in such a scenario?

Two months ago, a 68-year-old man suffered vision loss in his left eye. Eye examination at that time revealed all 4 quadrants intraretinal hemorrages, tortuous and dilated retinal veins. An injection was given inside the eye and he was advised to follow up in a week. He did not come for further evaluation after this. Few months later, he comes in with a red, painful eye as given in figure. What is the most appropriate treatment for this patient at this point?

A 4-year-old girl presents for evaluation of poor vision. After completion of retinoscopy of right eye of a child, it was noted that the vertical axis power was -4 dioptres and horizontal axis was -6 dioptres. What will be the refractive error for the right eye of the child?

options.label: B
options.text: Compound hypermetropic astigmatism with the rule

options.label: C
options.text: Compound myopic astigmatism against the rule

questions.correct_answer: C. Compound myopic astigmatism against the rule

questions.text: A hypermetropic patient with closed angles on gonioscopy has IOP of 25 mm Hg with normal optic disc with normal visual fields. Diagnosis?

options.label: C
options.text: IOP of this patient may be high

questions.text: A patient underwent a successful phacoemulsification with IOL in his right eye. He comes after 2 days complaining of pain in the affected eye with decreased visual acuity. The following features were noted: Eyelid swelling, chemosis, conjunctival injection and discharge Corneal haze Fibrinous exudate and hypopyon Vitritis with an impaired view of the fundus What is the diagnosis?
A 12 year old boy came to OPD and following sign was noted. Which investigation will be useful here?

A 16-year old boy comes to the emergency department due to sore throat and fever.He started having a mild sore throat after returning from summer camp about a week ago, and it has worsened in the last 2 days The patient also has right neck pain and earache but no cough or shortness of breath. He does not smoke tobacco or illicit drugs and is not sexually active. Temperature is 38.8 C (102 F): blood pressure is 118/74 mm Hg, and pulse is 104/min. Enlarged and tender cervical lymph nodes are present. The patient is not able to fully open his mouth, but examination of the oral cavity shows pooling of saliva a large right tonsil with swelling of the right soft palate: and deviation of the uvula to the left. Ear examination shows normal tympanic membranes. A rapid test for Streptococcus pyogenes is negative. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of these is the most common inherited form of sensorineural hearing loss?

options.label: A
options.text: Autosomal dominant syndromic sensorineural hearing loss

options.label: B
options.text: Autosomal recessive syndromic sensorineural hearing loss

options.label: C
options.text: Autosomal dominant nonsyndromic sensorineural hearing loss

options.label: D
options.text: Autosomal recessive nonsyndromic sensorineural hearing loss

questions.correct_answer: D. Autosomal recessive nonsyndromic sensorineural hearing loss

questions.text: A 31-year-old female, with history of left modified radical mastoidectomy 2 months prior for cholesteatoma, presented with one-week history of foul smelling blood stained ear discharge,fever, otalgia, neck pain, and neck swelling, with reduced neck movement. On examination, she appeared ill with high spiking fever and the left postauricular wound dehiscence was discharging pus. She also had torticollis, associated with fullness over the upper neck. Otoscopy on the left revealed copious amounts of mucopus in the middle ear and mastoid cavity and dull tympanic membrane (Figure 2). An urgent brain and neck Contrast Enhanced Computed Tomography (CECT) was done, showing soft tissue within the left mastoid cavityand parapharyngeal abscess, and bilateral internal jugular vein (IJV) thrombosis.All of the following statements are true regarding diagnosis except:

options.label: A
options.text: Meningitis is the most common intra cranial complication.

options.label: B
options.text: Ironing of mastoid is the most common sign.

options.label: C
options.text: No increase of cerebrospinal fluid pressure during compression of the internal jugular vein

options.label: D
options.text: HRCT is the investigation of choice diplopia present.

questions.correct_answer: B. Ironing of mastoid is the most common sign.

questions.text: A 45 year old male with history of nasal blockade foe 6 months. On examination, the patient had a nasal mass with and thick, “peanut-butter” eosinophilic mucus discharge. What is the probable diagnosis based on the CT scan:

options.label: B
options.text: Inability to safely embolize contributions from the internal carotid artery.

options.text: Few agents are available to occlude the small internal maxillary branches.

questions.correct_answer: B. Inability to safely embolize contributions from the internal carotid artery.

questions.text: Intranasal examination shows bilaterally symmetrical, bluish, fluctuant swelling in the anterior part of the nasal septum; this is suggestive of which of the following?
Choose the most appropriate statement regarding “Anatomy of the external ear”

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: The external meatus has the mastoid antrum anteriorly and the middle cranial fossa superiorly.

options.label: C
options.text: The great auricular (C1 and C2), the vagus and the trigeminal nerves supply sensation.

questions.correct_answer: C. The great auricular (C1 and C2), the vagus and the trigeminal nerves supply sensation.

questions.text: Which of the following statements best describes Bullard laryngoscopies?

questions.text: Which of the following is true regarding the presence of semicircular canal fistula from erosion by cholesteatoma?

questions.text: A patient presents with left-sided fluctuating hearing loss, aural fullness, and episodic vertigo. Which of the following test results is most consistent with the following symptoms:

A 46-year-old female presents to the emergency room with fever chest pain and hemoptysis. She came to visit her family from South India, where she works in a goat wool processing centre. Chest x-ray shows widened mediastinum. Sputum Gram smear shown in the image. Sputum and blood cultures reveal large gram-positive rods that form 'medusa head' colonies on standard media. The bacteria isolated from this patient most likely produce

A 27-year-old man comes to the emergency department due to several hours of right foot pain and swelling Last night he was working in the barn and stepped on an old nail. This morning the patent awoke with right foot pain near the injury site that has increased throughout the day and is accompanied by progressive swelling. He has no significant past medical history and takes no medications. The right foot is swollen with some erythema around the injury site Radiographic imaging reveals gas in the tissues. On urgent surgical exploration extensive tissue necrosis is present. Culture from the site reveals gram-positive rods. Which of the following best describes the mechanism of action of the toxin responsible for the necrotic effects seen in this patient?

Gram stain of a cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) sample from a 21-year-old male army recruit with fever and headache demonstrates lens-shaped Gram-negative cocci in pairs. Which of the following is the most likely route of meningeal contamination in this patient?
questions.correct_answer: D. Pharynx — blood — choroid plexus - meninges

questions.text: A 30-year-old man comes to the emergency department after a witnessed tonic-clonic seizure. The patient has no known medical problems. He works as an architect and owns a cat. He has no history of tuberculosis. On examination, he is afebrile and has no focal neurologic deficits or meningeal signs. An HIV antibody test and an interferon-gamma release assay test are negative. Chest x-ray is normal. An MRI of the brain reveals a 2 5-centimeter cyst within the left sylvian fissure that has minimal enhancement and no associated edema. Which of the following is the most likely means of acquisition of the infection responsible for this patient’s findings?
Choose the correct infective stage of the pathogen shown in the life cycle.

A 54-year-old male is brought to the ER with a one-week history of headaches and progressive confusion. He was hospitalized six months ago with viral esophagitis and two months ago with pneumocystis pneumonia. A 29-year-old male undergoes a rapid sequence induction to secure his airway for emergency trauma surgery to fix multiple limb fractures following a serious motorcycle accident. He is very cold and venous access was very difficult in A&E. As the thiopentone is injected into his left hand, the patient cries out in pain and his arm becomes suddenly very pale and cyanosed. What is the most suitable analgesic method to control this situation?

options.label: A

questions.text: Cisatracurium all are true except?

options.label: B

options.label: D

questions.correct_answer: D. May be preferred over atracurium in epileptic patients as it is not metabolized to laudanosine

questions.text: Regarding the second gas effect when using inhalation anaesthetic agents, all are true except?

options.label: A
options.text: The second gas effect is seen during the anaesthesia induction phase.

options.label: B
options.text: Rapid uptake of new gas from alveolus results in increased concentration of all other gases within alveolus.

options.label: C
options.text: 2nd gas effect causes delayed onset of action of an inhaled anesthetic agent.

options.label: D
options.text: This effect is seen with only nitrous oxide and xenon.

questions.correct_answer: C. 2nd gas effect causes delayed onset of action of an inhaled anesthetic agent.

questions.text: Regarding the bispectral index (BIS):

options.label: A

options.text: Higher values represent more cortical activity

questions.correct_answer: D. Higher values represent more cortical activity

A 53-year-old male presented with right upper quadrant abdominal pain, jaundice and pruritus. His LFT was abnormal with total bilirubin of 19.91 mg/dl, Aspartate Transaminase (AST) 418 U/L, Alanine transaminase (ALT) 695 U/L. Radiological work up, with computerized tomography (CT) showed a 24 × 29 × 33 mm renal mass, at the interpolar region of the right kidney with hepatosplenomegaly and without signs of choledocholithiasis, pancreatic masses. (Figure given). Diagnosis of RCC with deranged liver function was confirmed without any evidence of liver metastasis. Which of the following is false statement about this condition?

options.label: A
options.text: This is a paraneoplastic condition of RCC

options.label: C
options.text: Biopsy shows non specific hepatitis and lymphocytic infiltrates

options.label: D
options.text: IL 6 is high in most of the cases.

questions.correct_answer: B. Lever pathology is generally irreversible
